titles.title: Investment Incentives Act of 2002
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to encourage saving and investment, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 9/9/2002--Introduced. Investment Incentives Act of 2002 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) increase from $1,500 to $10,000 ($3,000 to $20,000 on a joint return) the limitation on capital losses allowed against ordinary income; (2) make the increase to the $5,000 amount allowed as an annual retirement contribution deduction effective immediately, instead of starting in 2008; (3) exclude from gross income $500 ($1,000 on a joint return) of dividends and interest.
